alert.note: Alert for Chippewa; Lac qui Parle; Yellow Medicine (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 09 at 9:37AM CDT until further notice by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in the Twin Cities has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Minnesota... Minnesota River at Montevideo affecting Lac qui Parle, Chippewa and Yellow Medicine Counties. .Runoff from previous rain will cause the Minnesota River at Montevideo to rise into flood stage. Additional rainfall is possible later this week, but that is not included in this forecast. For the Minnesota River...including Montevideo, Dawson, Granite Falls HWY 212, Morton, New Ulm, Mankato, Henderson MN19, Jordan, Savage...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Minnesota River at Montevideo. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Low lying areas and some roads along the river begin flooding, along with some basements of houses along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 900 AM CDT Monday, the stage was 13.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon and continue rising to a crest near 14.4 feet early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.

area.areaDesc: Chippewa; Lac qui Parle; Yellow Medicine
